page.title: 16MONKTON DENE PARK,JARROW
page.content: {Monkton Dene}is an area of Urban Open Space.It has a small stream running through it called the{Monkton Burn.} The stretch of dene from York Avenue to Butchers Bridge is called the {John {Jarvis Park. }During the 1930's many people in Jarrow were unemployed,the people of Surrey,led by John Jarvis raised money to help them.Part of the money was used to employ unemployed men to build {tennis courts,bowling {greens and a paddling pool. }Trees were planted as well,among those were Ash,White Horn Beam,Witch Elm,Lime and Poplar.The trees from York Avenue Bridge to Lukes Lane Estate were planted to commemorate the {Festival {of Britain in 1951.}They were planted on December 14th 1950.They include Silver Birch, Whitebeam, Ash, Black Poplar, Elder, Plane, Elm, Hawthorn, Beech, Sycamore, and Blackthorn.
